intro: Halimium heterophyllum var. erectum, commonly known as the upright halimium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is often found in open habitats such as coastal cliffs and dry meadows.
